Package C2G8_Project

Class FloorSubsystem

java.lang.Object
C2G8_Project.FloorSubsystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
DispatchConsumer, Runnable
class FloorSubsystem extends Object implements Runnable, DispatchConsumer
Author:
Jayson Mendoza FloorSubsystem: A class that reads the initial test script for the simulation, sends off the requests from the script to the Scheduler in the order that they are read, and waits for all of the requests sent off to return before sending a quit / shutdown message.

  • Constructor Details

    • FloorSubsystem

      public FloorSubsystem(String FloorName, int floorNumber, FloorSystem parent, Dispatcher dispatcher, Direction[] supportedDirections)
      Sets up a new FloorSubsystem representing a floor and its components within the system. This is designed to be run within a thread.
      Parameters:
      FloorName - The floor name used for identification purposes within the log
      floorNumber - The floor number this FloorSystem will represent
      parent - The FloorSystem that owns this FloorSubsystem. This used to coordinate the scenario time
      dispatcher - The dispatcher used to communicate with the scheduler and receive messages from the Scheduler
      supportedDirections - The directions this floor supports. For example the lowest floor doesn't necessary support down.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()

    • getDirectionLampOn

      public HashMap<Direction,Boolean> getDirectionLampOn()

    • getDirectionBtnOn

      public HashMap<Direction,Boolean> getDirectionBtnOn()

    • init

      private void init()

    • run

      public void run()
      Main run loop for Subsystem thread checks for a signal and processes it if found. It will then check scenario time and send requests to the scheduler for any new passengers that have arrived within the cycle.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Shuts down floorSubsystem on the next execution cycle

    • pushRequest

      public void pushRequest(PassengerRequest req)
      Adds a passenger request to the FloorSubsystems concern. This should only be called when the system is not running and will fail once the scenario has started. These do not need to be ordered and will be sorted when the scenario starts by trigger time. This is not thread safe.
      Parameters:
      req - The Passenger request to be added to the scenario.

    • sendRequest

      private void sendRequest(PassengerRequest request)
      Sends a request to the scheduler for a new passenger arrival.
      Parameters:
      request - The request informing the scheduler about the new passenger, its direction, and destination

    • receiveSignal

      public void receiveSignal(FloorSignal signal)
      Adds a new signal to a Queue for asynchronous processing. This is done instead of directly executing the signal because the FloorSystem will call this and it's execution context will be tied up while it is processing making it unable to process message until it concludes. The signal queue passes responsibility of the signal processing to the thread.
      Parameters:
      signal - The signal to be processed.

    • nextSignal

      private FloorSignal nextSignal()
      Gets the next signal to be processed from the queue in a thread safe way. Isolated into its own function for performance so lock is released as soon as data has been retrieved.
      Returns:
      The next Floor Signal to be processed.

    • processNextSignal

      private void processNextSignal()
      Process the next signal in the queue. Since this is a queue we can allow additions while we read since additions will occur on the other end of the queue.

    • activateLamp

      private void activateLamp(Direction dir)
      Activates a direction lamp to signal the arrival of the elevator. Only one direction can be active at a time, and direction can be cleared.
      Parameters:
      dir - The direction of the elevators travel

    • receiveDispatch

      public void receiveDispatch(String topic, String data)
      Convert data from dispatcher into the appropriate data type and then call a method that will add it to a queue for processing. The queue is used to process asynchronously because the dispatcher thread will be calling and executing this method and would be tied up and unable to receive new messages while this runs. Thus we let the floorSubsystem worker thread handle it.
      Specified by:
      receiveDispatch in interface DispatchConsumer
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic for the message received from the dispatcher
      data - The data payload received from the dispatcher

    • getSubscriberNameIdentifier

      public String getSubscriberNameIdentifier()
      Description copied from interface: DispatchConsumer
      This is the name that will be used to identify this DispatchConsumer within the Dispatchers logs
      Specified by:
      getSubscriberNameIdentifier in interface DispatchConsumer
      Returns:
      The string name that will be used to represent this dispatch consmer in logs
